intro: Benthamiella lanata, commonly known as the woolly benthamiella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
